description: You arrive in a quaint village nestled at the edge of the wilds. Cobblestone paths, wooden homes, and distant laughter fill the air. Something about this place feels safe... but not without mystery.
name: Village

story_actions.story_text: A hooded villager steps forward. You... don't look like you're from here.
The forest's been talking. Something stirs beyond the stone hill.
My brother went looking. Days ago. Hasn’t come back.
I saw his trail. It led into the hollow grove. Will you look for him?
You agree to help and note the direction of the hollow grove.
Talk to the old blacksmith sharpening a blade.
Pet a friendly village dog.
Read the weathered notice board near the inn.
Peek inside the chapel — old and still, candles flickering inside.
The villager listens in silence. So he’s gone then... Thank you. He deserved peace.
The elder leans in. There’s a place they don’t speak of — carved in stone, hidden from the sun.
Some say it teaches the path of rebirth. But few return from the temple unchanged.
Someone mentions the chapel keeper once spoke of soul rituals long ago.
You lift a loose stone behind the altar. Beneath it rests a shimmering vessel — cold to the touch.
Stroll through the village square. Merchants greet you with nods and warm smiles.
Speak with the reeve mediating a land dispute.
Help harvest turnips in the outer fields.
Trade your turnips for lantern oil at the market.
Deliver the lantern oil to the chapel keeper for the dusk lighting.
Visit the smithy and watch sparks fly as iron meets anvil.
Assist the blacksmith in forging nails.
Help the herbalist sisters dry bundles of lavender and yarrow.
Bring herbs to the chapel to prepare for dusk rites.
Read the public noticeboard — faded ink, fresh concerns.
A child speaks of a ghost light in the hills beyond the field.

You meet Elder Branna near the well. She tells you of a massive landslide that has buried the forest path to the east. 'It fell after a quake some winters ago. We've sent for help, but none came. That path must be cleared. There are people waiting.'

The blacksmith crosses his arms. 'That landslide? It's not just rubble. There's old stone, roots grown thick, and slabs heavier than oxen. You'd need the strength of ten men and something to shift the earth itself.'
Attempt to clear the landslide blocking the eastern path.
